strings.Value: "My mother is dead, and I... feel nothing?" {n}Nortellara speaks in a quiet voice.{/n} "Perhaps my heart is made of stone, just like hers? Forgive me, {mf|king|queen}. There are words that must be said aloud."

{n}The young elf looks at the bodies of her mother and her other relatives, shocked.{/n} "An endless circle of death... It began in {g|Kyonin}Kyonin{/g} and ended here. What was it all for? Now the only one left to ask — is me myself." {n}She looks at you as if she'd just awoken.{/n} "If it makes any sense at all, I'm... grateful for my salvation. I want you to know, {mf|king|queen} — from this day forth, I owe you a great debt."

"I made two mistakes with her," {n}Nortellara says as you approach.{/n} "The first time, back in {g|Kyonin}Kyonin{/g} — when I defended her before the court and argued that she might change. The second time, here, when I sought to kill, believing that she could never change."
"I owe you my life, {mf|king|queen}. My life and my hopes. I pray that one day I might repay you in kind, but for now..."
"I wish to give you one of my mother's things. I don't think I'll ever be able to touch this again. Thank you for everything, and farewell!"
